description:
'''Dappankuthu''' (or simply '''Kuthu'''; {{IPAc-en|d|ə|p|ɑː|ŋ|k|u|θ|u}}) is a folk dance and music genre, that is typically danced to the [[Gaana]] [[music genre]] or Kuthu Beats with an emphasis on [[Percussion instrument|percussion]] performed in the [[South India]]n state of [[Tamil Nadu]]. It is one of several popular genres employed in film music, mainly in [[Tamil cinema]] and other South films, filmed and produced by people of [[Tamil culture]]. 
Unlike classical Indian dances such as [[bharatanatyam]] or [[kathakali]], dappankuthu is relatively informal in that it has no structured, repeated steps and dancers do not learn through formal dance classes. It shares its emphasis on percussion with older folk dances of [[Tamil Nadu]], such as [[kummi]] and kolattam.
